lines.text: Okay, okay, okay, okay, okay, okay, o—

annotations.text: This intro is reminiscent of the closing moments of the track, introducing the listener to the “okay” infused melody.

lines.text:
You live in my dream state
Relocate my fantasy
I stay in reality
You live in my dream state
Any time I count sheep
That's the only time we make up, make up
You exist behind my eyelids, my eyelids
Now, I don't wanna wake up

annotations.text:
Tyler’s ideal lover doesn’t seem to actually exist. The twitter account tylersbio keeps an archive of Tyler’s twitter bios, as he changes them frequently. A few months before this song dropped, Tyler’s twitter bio was “he exists behind my eyelids”:

https://twitter.com/Tylersbio/status/819583613398196224

Tyler’s use of a male pronoun in the tweet and the outro on “Sometimes…” where we hear a boy’s voice (Wyatt Navarro) ask Shane Powers to “play the song about [him]” on Golf Radio heavily imply this song is about a man.

20/20 vision is a term used to express normal visual acuity measured at a distance of 20 feet. If you have 20/20 vision, you can see clearly at 20 feet what should normally be seen at that distance.

This line can be completed by the following, in which Tyler states that his cupid has a perfect vision, so he got hit with precision.

Fellow OF member Frank Ocean used a similar line on “Slide”:

If we could see in twenty twin
Twice we could see it ‘til the end

lines.text: Cupid hit me, Cupid hit me withprecision,I

annotations.text: In Roman mythology, Cupid is the god of desire, affection and love. Cupid is said to have a crossbow, and anyone hit by one of his arrows is to instantaneously fall in love.

lines.text:
Wonder if you lookboth wayswhen you crossmy mind(Yeah)
I said, I said

annotations.text:
This is a play on the common advice to look both ways before crossing the street—if someone didn’t look both ways, they’d be careless, which suggests the person Tyler’s addressing is reckless when it comes to Tyler’s feelings.

When you cross the road, you’re checking to see if cars are coming, so Tyler may also be noting how love can hit you from any direction. It might also mean that the person didn’t know what was coming in terms of Tyler’s love. If they had looked both ways, they would have known how love would unfold. It’s also possible that “both ways” may be a hint towards bisexuality.

It’s also very likely Tyler is making a conscious reference to George Clinton’s bridge on Kendrick Lamar’s 2015 song “Wesley’s Theory”:

Leavin' miracles metaphysically in a state of euphoria
Look both ways before you cross my mind

lines.text:
I'msick of, sick of, sick of, sick of chasin'
You're the one that's always running through mydaydream, I
I can only seeyour facewhen I closemy eyes
(Uh-huh)

annotations.text:
The line “I can only see your face when I close my eyes” seems to have a double meaning, and can be interpreted in two ways.

Firstly, Tyler could be placing emphasis on “when I close my eyes”, saying that the person whom he’s referring to (the “your” in this line) only exists in his fantasies: the love he imagines between them is perfect, and the only way for this love to be possible is when he is closing his eyes – when Tyler is dreaming or fantasizing.

Tyler could also be placing emphasis on “only see your face”, meaning that his love interest’s (the “your”) face is the only thing he can see when he closes his eyes, the only thing he wants to see. He is so in love, or “infatuated” (as he mentions in the second verse), with this said love interest that he cannot think, fantasize, or (day)dream about anything else.

The two are very distinct, yet somehow the two meanings can beautifully coexist, adding a lot more depth to Tyler’s writing.

lines.text:
Can I get a kiss? (Ah)
And can you make it last forever?
I said I'm 'bout to go to war (Uh-huh)
And I don't know if I'ma see you again
Can I get a kiss? (Can I?)
And can you make it last forever? (Can you?)
I said I'm 'bout to go to war ('Bout to)
And I don't know if I'ma see you again

annotations.text:
This chorus, sung by Kali Uchis, explores the overall theme of longing and fantasy expressed by Tyler throughout the song.

Tyler, “speaking” to his dream lover with the aid of a feminine voice, wants to make this love last, even though it’s probably never going to happen given its idealized and dream-like nature.

It brings to light the paradoxical nature of forbidden and/or idealized love, namely the desire to make it last forever when circumstances most likely make it hard or impossible to happen.

Finally, “I’m about to go to war” refers to Tyler waking up from his fantasy. After waking up he goes back to the real world, which he describes as going to war. Tyler spoke about this in his interview with Jerrod Carmichael, FLOWER BOY: a conversation

Going to war, that just- I’m gon' wake up… and go to the real world.

lines.text: Ugh, switch it up

annotations.text: Tyler was switching up from singing to rap.

lines.text:
I said, okay, okay, okay, okey-dokey, my infatuation
Interrelatin' to another form of, what you call it? (Love)

annotations.text: Tyler found his love interest attractive, but now he has fallen in love with them.

lines.text: Oh, yeah, oh, yeah, oh, yeah, I ain't met you, I've been lookin'

annotations.text: This line hints at Tyler’s search for a soulmate, which he has yet to find, but shows that he still holds hope that one day he may find them. He’s also tired of waiting to see if that love may come around on its own,  he’s begun his own journey of doing something about the situation which may increase the chances of the two finally meeting.

lines.text: Stop the waitin' 'fore I stop the chasin', like a alcoholic

annotations.text:
A “chaser” is a non-alcoholic beverage or a light beer that one drinks after their alcohol to help them wash down the previous alcoholic drink.

As alcoholics aren’t bothered by the taste of liquor, they stopped needing something to chase it with. Similarly, Tyler plans to stop chasing this person if they keep hesitating to admit their love to him.

lines.text: "You don't understand me"  – What the fuck do you mean?

annotations.text: Tyler’s love interest says that Tyler doesn’t understand them, however, Tyler is confused about this and elaborates in the following lines.

lines.text: It's them rose-tinted cheeks, yeah, it's them dirt-colored eyes

annotations.text:
Tyler describes the person whom he fell in love with. Oddly enough, Wyatt, Tyler’s rumored boyfriend, has slightly rosy cheeks and brown eyes.

https://twitter.com/tylerthecreator/status/823560640501456896

The use of words like “rose tinted” and “dirt-colored” are meant to fit in with the theme of flowers and gardens in the album.

lines.text: Sugar-honey iced tea, bumblebee on the scene

annotations.text:
“Sugar honey iced tea” is an expansive euphemism for the term “shit.” The word can be used positively as a term for holding someone in high regard such as, “You’re the shit."

As bees are attracted to sweet drinks, Tyler symbolizes himself as the bee, and the person he’s interested in as the tea. This could also refer to the album cover for Flower Boy, which features multiple bumblebees.



This may also be a reference to the song “Suga Honey Iced Tea” by Kelis off of her album “Tasty”.  Tyler is a fan of Kelis and the song’s producers, the Neptunes, and mentioned the song in this tweet from 2012:

https://twitter.com/tylerthecreator/status/232176781803782144

lines.text: Yeah, I'd give up my bakery to have a piece of your pie

annotations.text:
Tyler would give up all of his sources of income to have a part of the one he loves, as expressed through baking-themed word play.

“Bread” is a synonym to “money,” something Tyler makes a lot of through his music and clothing. By giving up “the bakery” (a place where “bread” is made), Tyler would be sacrificing all that he earns just to get a part of the person he has feelings for.

lines.text: Ugh

annotations.text:
Could possibly be a shout out to Pusha T, who Tyler has said he is a huge fan of. “Yeugh!” is an adlib which Pusha uses very often in his music, especially at the end of a verse. The two have even collaborated, on Pusha’s 2011 track “Trouble on My Mind.”



He is expressing disgust at the end of this line because of its lovey dovey nature, Tyler raps plenty about love/loving someone/something but he often has mixed feelings towards the subject, He does this in IFHY

“I fucking hate you
But I love you”

You can also see him doing this in She

One, two, you’re the girl that I want
Three, four, five, six, seven, shit
Eight is the bullets if you say no after all this
And I just couldn’t take it, you’re so motherfuckin' gorgeous
Gorgeous, baby you’re gorgeous
I just wanna drag your lifeless body to the forest
And fornicate with it but that’s because I’m in love with
You cunt

20/20 vision is a term used to express normal visual acuity measured at a distance of 20 feet. If you have 20/20 vision, you can see clearly at 20 feet what should normally be seen at that distance.

This line can be completed by the following, in which Tyler states that his cupid has a perfect vision, so he got hit with precision.

Fellow OF member Frank Ocean used a similar line on “Slide”:

If we could see in twenty twin
Twice we could see it ‘til the end

lines.text: One more time?

annotations.text: Kali thought that the producer/manager said to do one more take, but they kept her talking in anyways because of the artistic value.
